results.title: DNA
results.brief_description: The likeness of an offspring to its parents, whatever the species, has been traced to a unique molecule that controls the production of proteins and transmits characteristics. This genetic material, dioxyribonucleic acid, or DNA - the hereditary material of life - is described and illustrated in this film by color animation. Mutations are also discussed. A film for science students.

results.title: Djeli: Conte D'aujourd'hui = Bloodline: A Modern Tale
results.brief_description:
Fanta and Karamoko, two students from Ivory Coast, are in love and making plans to marry. They come from the same village and their families have known each other for a long time. However, Karamoko, is the son a a griot and he is not allowed to marry Fanta who descends from a noble lineage. The families oppose the union in the name of tradition.

Credits: Producer, director, Fadika Kramo-Lancine ; photography, Christian Lacoste, N’Gouan Kacou ; music, Kyate Sori Kandia.
Cast: Tatou Ouatara, Joachim Ouatara Yao

results.title: Django Reindhardt
results.brief_description:
This short film about Jazz legend Django Reinhardt is introduced by a text by Jean Cocteau. Commentary by Chris Marker, narrated by Yves Montand. Other musicians featured include Stephane Grapelli, Hubert Rostain, Andre Ekyan, Henri Crolla, Babyk Reinhardt.

Credits: Producer, Madeleine Casanova-Rodriguez ; director, writer, Paul Paviot ; photography, Jean Le Herissey ; music, Django Reinhardt.

results.title: Dizzy acrobat
results.creator_credit: Walter Lantz, Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Woody Woodpecker creates absolute mayhem at the circus as he tears through circus tents and upsets the animals, eventually leading the cops to the high wire on a bicycle.

results.title: DIY: the top 50 jobs
results.creator_credit: Lifetime, Sheldon Greenberg, Rob Page and Kat Arundel
results.brief_description: Probably the most valuable asset in our lifetime is the home we live in, so it’s well worth taking as much care of it as possible. All too often though, it’s the jobs which really need doing which seem so difficult to do yourself. It does not really seem worth bringing in the expensive professionals. Help is now at hand, “DIY - the top 50 jobs” is a practical guide aimed at beginners. It shows you how to tackle a whole range of subjects from home plumbing and electrics to painting, decorating and home security. It quite simply gives you the basic grounding and confidence to do the fifty most important jobs around the home. The subjects covered are: exterior decoration and maintenance, home security, insulation, electrics (WARNING - provides advice which does not conform to Australian Electrical Specifications and Regulations), plumbing, interior decoration, and fixtures and fittings.

results.title: Divorcing Jack
results.creator_credit: Robert Cooper, Winchester Films, BBC, Scala and David Caffrey
results.brief_description: Starkey (David Thewlis) is an Irish journalist, known for his cynicism and satirical wit, who nurses a serious drinking problem. When Starkey is kicked out of the marital home for infidelity, he falls into bed with the beautiful Margaret, whose ex-boyfriend is connected with the IRA. When Margaret turns up dead Starkey is the number one suspect and is forced to go on the lam, with several factions, including the police and the IRA after his scalp. An upcoming election is somehow linked with the murder and as Starkey evades capture (with a lame disguise and the help of a nurse who also works as a nun-o-gram), he struggles to figure out how the two are connected. “Divorcing Jack” has plenty of bloodshed, beatings, car chases, torture and swearing as well as a convoluted plot involving various terrorist factions. A black comedy that takes a cynical view of the machinations of politics, the press and the Northern Ireland peace process, “Divorcing Jack” has a script riddled with deft one-liners, all delivered in a thick Irish brogue.

results.title: Divorce Iranian style
results.creator_credit: Ziba Mir-Hosseini, Kim Longinotto and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Set in a Tehran courtroom before Judge Deldar, this documentary by British documentary filmmaker Longinotto follows the plight of three women who must provide a convincing argument to grant them a divorce. An insightful look which shatters the myth that Muslim women are passive, especially when their happiness is at stake.

results.title: Divorce can happen to the nicest people
results.creator_credit: Stephen Smallwood, Paternoster Nominees and Consolidated Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Mayle, author of successful children’s information books such as “Where did I come from?”, examines the issue of divorce in an attempt to reassure children about the anxieties they may be facing in their own lives. The program is geared towards making children understand that divorce is not the end of their family; focusing on why couples fall in and out of love; what happens to parents when they separate and how the family must cope with new responsibilities. The program seeks to comfort children who may be blaming themselves for the family breakup. Animated and simply narrated, this program is more suited to middle primary school children and above.

results.title: Divorce and young people
results.creator_credit: Golden Coast Film Productions and Nick Vincent
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the most common fears, conflicts and problems that children face when their parents are going through divorce and demonstrates certain methods of coping with the various emotions that arise. Offers solutions to the problems that children find most difficult to solve in a divorce situation.

results.title: Divorce = Li Hun [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Wang Haowei
results.brief_description: Set in Beijing in the early thirties, “Li Hun” recounts the cultural conficts faced by a well-natured match-maker caught between Chinese tradition and the Western ideas of marriage and family that are beginning to take hold amongst his friends. Adapted from the original work by the famous drama writer Lao She. In Mandarin with English subtitles.
